abstract: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts, which last month unveiled plans to go public in a move that would which would value the firm at $12 billion to $15 billion, said Henry Kravis, George Roberts and its other owners raked in $1.3 billion in cash and in-kind distributions in 2007 and took home another $106.3 million in the first quarter of 2008.
snippet: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts, which last month unveiled plans to go public in a move that would which would value the firm at $12 billion to $15 billion, said Henry Kravis, George Roberts and its other owners raked in $1.3 billion in cash and in-kind d...
lead_paragraph: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts, which last month unveiled plans to go public in a move that would which would value the firm at $12 billion to $15 billion, said Henry Kravis, George Roberts and its other owners raked in $1.3 billion in cash and in-kind distributions in 2007 and took home another $106.3 million in the first quarter of 2008.
